Due to the resemblance of CCT curves and the upper parts of TTT curves 47, TTT curves are widely used to schematically describe the crystallization process of a melt during continuous cooling 2 4 47. The measured times are modified by adding (2000 K – 990 K)/(1 Ks −1) for the comparison with the cooling curves from 2000 K, because the critical cooling rate of BT0 for glass formation is estimated about 1 K s −1. Now that the different phase fields are established, the solidification behaviour under different cooling rates can be discussed qualitatively.
